Method Detail

writeTuple

public int writeTuple(Tuple tuple,
                      byte[] bytes,
                      int start)
               throws StorageManagerException
Writes a tuple to a byte array -- should be used when there is page buffering.

Parameters:
tuple - the tuple to be written.
bytes - the byte array the tuple should be written to.
start - the starting offset into the byte array.
Returns:
the new offset in the byte array.
Throws:
StorageManagerException - thrown whenever there is an I/O error.

readTuple

public Pair<Tuple,java.lang.Integer> readTuple(byte[] bytes,
                                               int start)
                                        throws StorageManagerException
Reads a tuple from a byte array -- should be used when there is page buffering.

Parameters:
bytes - the byte array.
start - the starting offset into the byte array.
Returns:
a pair consisting of the tuple read and the new offset in the byte array.
Throws:
StorageManagerException - thrown whenever there is an I/O error.

dumpSlot

protected int dumpSlot(java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Comparable> type,
                       Tuple t,
                       int s,
                       byte[] bytes,
                       int start)
                throws StorageManagerException
Low-level method to dump a tuple slot to a byte array.

Parameters:
type - the type of the slot.
t - the tuple.
s - the slot of the tuple to be dumped.
bytes - the byte array where the slot will be dumped.
start - the starting offset.
Returns:
the new offset in the array.
Throws:
StorageManagerException - thrown whenever there is an I/O error.

fetch

protected Pair<? extends java.lang.Comparable,java.lang.Integer> fetch(java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Comparable> type,
                                                                       byte[] bytes,
                                                                       int start)
                                                                throws StorageManagerException
Low-level method to read a slot from a byte array.

Parameters:
type - the type of the slot to be read.
bytes - the input byte array.
start - the starting offset in the byte array.
Returns:
a pair of (value, offset) with the value read and the new offset in the byte array.
Throws:
StorageManagerException - thrown whenever there is an I/O error.

Calculates the byte size of a tuple given its relation. (Lame, lame, lame... I should hang my head in shame. Or go play a game. Or see if I can start a big fire with a small flame. Or stop looking for words that rhyme with lame.)
